fullText: While it is debatable that the life of the newly emancipated Britney Spears is a fairy tale at present, the singer's catalog of hits surely has the feel of a fable with feminist-forward empowerment. That's what writer Jon Hartmere and director-choreographers Keone and Mari Madrid use as the basis for "Once Upon a One More Time," their Broadway twist on staid, storybook romanticism and tired male-centric tropes. With its giddy, surprisingly caustic script and rapier-fast score, this pop-musical course correction (authorized by Spears, post-conservatorship) is built for speed and social awareness.
dtliExcerpt: This jukebox musical built around Britney Spears songs is a colorful, energetic and surprisingly sweet confection that delivers exactly what it promises.
showScoreExcerpt: This jukebox musical built around Britney Spears songs is a colorful, energetic and surprisingly sweet confection that delivers exactly what it promises.

llmScore.reasoning: The review uses consistently positive descriptors and indicates the show successfully achieves its goals, suggesting a clear but not effusive recommendation.
